com.inet.html.parser
Class PushReader

java.lang.Object
  java.io.Reader
      java.io.BufferedReader
          com.inet.html.parser.PushReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.lang.Readable
public class PushReader
extends java.io.BufferedReader

An extended buffered reader which allows to push character back into the reader queue.

Return a character to the stream.

readQuotedChar

public char readQuotedChar()
Read a html encoded character

Returns:
the char or & if it is not a valid encoding

checkForUtf8Prefix

public void checkForUtf8Prefix()
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               javax.swing.text.ChangedCharSetException
Check if the document start with an UTF8 prefix. This are 3 Bytes with an ASCII code page. With UTF8 this are a single character 0xFEFF.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs
javax.swing.text.ChangedCharSetException - if the prefix was find and the document is not allready UTF8 encoded

startTransaction

public void startTransaction()
Activates the transaction mode, which will buffer all characters read. These chars can be re-enqueued to the reader if the transaction fails.

rollBack

public void rollBack()
Does a rollback for all characters fetched since the transaction was started.

commit

public void commit()
Resets the rollback buffer and deactivates the transaction mode

shutDown

public void shutDown()
              throws java.io.IOException
Shuts down the stream. This causes a close on the underlying stream. The Reader will return -1 on read from now on without throwing an IO-Exception.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - thrown, if the close fails

readKey

public java.lang.String readKey()
                         throws java.io.IOException
Read a key inside from < and >.

Returns:
the key or an empty string. Will return null on an invalid tag
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

readValue

public java.lang.String readValue()
                           throws java.io.IOException
Read a value inside from < and >. Possible quotes are removed. Is never null.

Returns:
the value
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

skipScript

public void skipScript()
                throws java.io.IOException
Skip the context of a SCRIPT tag

Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

skipTag

public boolean skipTag()
                throws java.io.IOException
Skip the attributes of a tag including the '>'

Returns:
true, if the > was found, false if a '<' was found
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

skipComment

public java.lang.String skipComment()
                             throws java.io.IOException
Skip the HTML Comment and thus anything until the end of the document or the next -->

Returns:
the comment content including the closing bracket
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
